reviewText: This movie of course is reminiscent of the "Saw" franchise, but manages to put it's own spin on things. The thrills and chills here are based on good writing, acting, and a plot that works, not some big budget explosion fest. When I am still thinking about the movie a day later, I know it worked for me.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found this an effective little horror/suspense thriller about a group of friends who get together for innocent fun and find themselves in a Saw-like situation.  Who's hosting the fun and games?  Is it the cameraman obsessively videoing every moment, to the annoyance of all?  Or is it someone else?  The minister maybe?  Shades of Bunuel, with a nifty script and skilled ensemble acting.
summary: Yeah, I've been to this party
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was just unsettling.  Watching the characters all freak the hell out when they hear they've been poisoned, trying to figure out who is the psycho among them...it's all good fun really.  ;)  Disturbing, unsettling, but well done and worth it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great suspenseful movie.  They've all been poisoned, and they're all freaking out and don't know who the crazy person is (one of them?).  It's a familiar story but a fresh take, & it does keep you guessing.  I was "sure" who the culprit was like 87 times.
